data.prayer: Father, let the threatened of Córdoba, Argentina know that it is better to trust in you than to trust in humans.
data.verse: It is better to take refuge in the Lord than to trust in humans.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Córdoba, Argentina
data.section_summary: What needs would people have here?

data.prayer: Father, for all those you call to look after your flock from the 338,973 believers in Córdoba, please, make them passionate about hearing your Word.
data.verse: Therefore, you shepherds, hear the word of the LORD.

data.prayer: Spirit, please convict the believers in Córdoba, Argentina to not assume the ministry is for professional clergy, but for all who have been called by you.
Father, you have chosen the weak things of this world to confound the strong. Make the poor and outcast in the state of Córdoba a testimony of your strength.
data.verse: God chose the foolish things of the world that he might put to shame those who are wise. God chose the weak things of the world, that he might put to shame the things that are strong;

data.prayer: Lord, remember the Turk people. Make the Turk people a chosen race, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people for your own possession.
Father, help media producers communicate the gospel in a way that is understandable to the people of Córdoba, Argentina.
data.verse: But from there, you will seek the LORD your God, and you will find Him if you search for Him with all your heart and all your soul.

data.prayer: Spirit, please give new believers a yearning to see you praised in Córdoba, Argentina.
data.verse: Declare his glory among the nations, his marvelous deeds among all peoples.

data.section_summary:
the state of Córdoba, Argentina has a population of 3,066,800.

We estimate Córdoba has 338,973 people who might know Jesus, 2,516,484 people who might know about Jesus culturally, and 211,342 people who do not know Jesus.

This is 1 believer for every 9 neighbors who need Jesus.

data.prayer: Father, move the 338,973 believers in the state of Córdoba to say "Not our will, but yours be done", like Jesus.
data.verse: He withdrew about a stone’s throw beyond them, knelt down and prayed, "Father, if you are willing, take this cup from me; yet not my will, but yours be done."
